p: Over 170 natural derivatives were screened in search of currently no approved antiviral therapy of Marburg virus disease (MVD) [ 117]. The (–)-bornyl ester derivatives containing saturated N-heterocycles exhibited the highest antiviral activity and can specifically inhibit MarV entry with the efficiency being comparable to that of the previously described verapamil. (–)-Borneol itself is not active against both tested pseudotypes. Among low-toxic (–)-borneol derivatives, some of the compounds inter alia 138– 141 turned out to be relatively specific inhibitors of MarV-GP mediated infection (SC > 10). Compound 139 containing a methylpiperidine moiety exhibits the highest virus-specific activity, which is twice as high as that of the reference.
